text: In the first year of Darius son of Ahasuerus, who was of Median descent and who had been appointed king over the Babylonian empire—

in the first year of his reign I, Daniel, came to understand from the sacred books that the number of years for the fulfilling of the desolation of Jerusalem, which had come as the Lord’s message to the prophet Jeremiah, would be 70 years.

So I <st data-num="05414" class="">turned</st> my <st data-num="06440" class="">attention</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0136" class="">Lord</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="01245" class="">implore</st> him by <st data-num="08605" class="">prayer</st> and <st data-num="08469" class="">requests</st>, with <st data-num="06685" class="">fasting</st>, <st data-num="08242" class="">sackcloth</st>, and <st data-num="0665" class="">ashes</st>.<n id="3" />

I prayed to the Lord my God, confessing in this way:

“O Lord, great and awesome God who is faithful to his covenant with those who love him and keep his commandments,

we have <st data-num="02398" class="">sinned</st>! We have <st data-num="05753 07561">done what is</st> <st data-num="05753" class="">wrong</st> and <st data-num="07561" class="">wicked</st>; we have <st data-num="04775" class="">rebelled</st> by <st data-num="05493" class="">turning away</st> from your <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st> and <st data-num="04941" class="">standards</st>.
We have not paid attention to your servants the prophets, who spoke by your authority to our kings, our leaders, and our ancestors, and to all the inhabitants of the land as well.

“You are righteous, O Lord, but we are humiliated this day—the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far away in all the countries in which you have scattered them because they have behaved unfaithfully toward you.
O Lord, we have been humiliated—our kings, our leaders, and our ancestors—because we have sinned against you.

Yet the <st data-num="0136" class="">Lord</st> our <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> is <st data-num="07356" class="">compassionate</st> and <st data-num="05547" class="">forgiving</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">even though</st> we have <st data-num="04775" class="">rebelled</st> against him.
We have not obeyed the Lord our God by living according to his laws that he set before us through his servants the prophets.

“All Israel has broken your law and turned away by not obeying you. Therefore you have poured out on us the judgment solemnly threatened in the law of Moses the servant of God, for we have sinned against you.

He has <st data-num="06965" class="">carried out</st> his <st data-num="01697 0834 01696">threats</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> us and our <st data-num="08199" class="">rulers</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="08199" class="">were over</st><n id="3" /> us by <st data-num="0935" class="">bringing</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">calamity</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> us—<st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> has <st data-num="06213" class="">happened</st> to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> has <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> been <st data-num="06213" class="">equaled</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="08064" class="">heaven</st>!

Just as it is written in the law of Moses, so all this calamity has come on us. Still we have not tried to pacify the Lord our God by turning back from our sin and by seeking wisdom from your reliable moral standards.
The Lord was mindful of the calamity, and he brought it on us. For the Lord our God is just in all he has done, and we have not obeyed him.
“Now, O Lord our God, who brought your people out of the land of Egypt with great power and made a name for yourself that is remembered to this day—we have sinned and behaved wickedly.

O Lord, according to all your justice, please turn your raging anger away from your city Jerusalem, your holy mountain. For due to our sins and the iniquities of our ancestors, Jerusalem and your people are mocked by all our neighbors.
“So now, our God, accept the prayer and requests of your servant, and show favor to your devastated sanctuary for your own sake.

<st data-num="05186" class="">Listen</st> <st data-num="0241" class="">attentively</st>,<n id="1" /> my <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, and <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st>! <st data-num="06491" class="">Open</st> your <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> and <st data-num="07200" class="">look</st> on our <st data-num="08077" class="">desolated ruins</st><n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="05892 0834">city</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> your <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> it is <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">because of</st> our own <st data-num="06666" class="">righteous deeds</st> that <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> are <st data-num="05307 08469">praying</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">to</st> you,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">but</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">because</st> your <st data-num="07356" class="">compassion</st> is <st data-num="07227" class="">abundant</st>.
O Lord, hear! O Lord, forgive! O Lord, pay attention, and act! Don’t delay, for your own sake, O my God! For your city and your people are called by your name.”
While I was still speaking and praying, confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel and presenting my request before the Lord my God concerning his holy mountain—

yes, <st data-num="05750" class="">while</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> was <st data-num="01696" class="">still</st> <st data-num="08605" class="">praying</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="01403" class="">Gabriel</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> I had <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> <st data-num="08462" class="">previously</st><n id="2" /> in a <st data-num="02377" class="">vision</st>, was <st data-num="05060 0413">approaching</st> me in my state of <st data-num="03286" class="">extreme</st> <st data-num="03288" class="">weariness</st>,<n id="3" /> around the <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st> of the <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st> <st data-num="04503" class="">offering</st>.

He <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> me, <st data-num="0995" class="">instructing</st> me <st data-num="0559" class="">as follows</st>:<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="01840" class="">Daniel</st>, I have <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="07919" class="">impart</st> <st data-num="0998" class="">understanding</st> to you.
At the beginning of your requests a message went out, and I have come to convey it to you, for you are of great value in God’s sight. Therefore consider the message and understand the vision:

“Seventy weeks have been determined

concerning your people and your holy city

to put an end to rebellion,

to bring sin to completion,

to atone for iniquity,

to bring in perpetual righteousness,

to seal up the prophetic vision,

and to anoint a Most Holy Place.

So know and understand:

From the issuing of the command to restore and rebuild

Jerusalem until an anointed one, a prince arrives,

there will be a period of seven weeks and sixty-two weeks.

It will again be built, with plaza and moat,

but in distressful times.

Now after the sixty-two weeks,

an anointed one will be cut off and have nothing.

As for the city and the sanctuary,

the people of the coming prince will destroy them.

But his end will come speedily like a flood.

Until the end of the war that has been decreed

there will be destruction.

He will confirm a covenant with many for one week.

But in the middle of that week

he will bring sacrifices and offerings to a halt.

On the wing of abominations will come one who destroys,

until the decreed end is poured out on the one who destroys.”
